results.title: Rain
results.creator_credit: Christine Jeffs, Philippa Campbell, Communicado, New Zealand Film Commission and Rose Road
results.brief_description: Based on the novel “Rain” by Kirsty Gunn from New Zealand filmmaker Christine Jeffs comes the story of an adolescent girl’s life-changing summer holiday. The girl’s parent’s marriage is not strong and her mother has an affair with another holiday-maker, fuelled along by alcohol. Confusion and jealousy occur in the young girl’s mind as she tries to come to terms with her own sexual awakening while trying to decipher adult relationships. Moody and atmospheric, the pace of the film is as leisurely as the holiday with gentle seaside in the day and partying parents at night. A mix of carefree playfulness (as the girl and her young brother frolic in this idyll) with a darker foreboding and uneasiness just under the surface. Original soundtrack by Neil Finn. Cast includes Alicia Fulford-Wierzbicki, Sarah Peirse, Marton Csokas, Alistair Browning, Aaron Murphy.

results.title: Anatomy of Hell = Anatomie de L'Enfer [DVD] (E)
results.creator_credit: Catherine Breillat, Jean-Francois Lepetit, CB Films (France) and Flach Film
results.brief_description: A woman at a nightclub is rejected by her gay, male lover, becomes suicidal and goes to the toilets to cut her wrists. She is prevented from further harm by the kindness of another gay man (played by Italian porn star Rocco Stiffredi) who follows her. Their conversation leads the woman to set up a challenge or deal, that she will pay this man and he is to listen and learn about how men see women’s bodies. Over the next four nights the two engage in the most intimate acts and conversations in trying to work out the male/female sexual dynamic. From the controversial director of 1999’s “Romance” Catherine Breillat wants to shock with close-ups of genitals and discussions of menstruation that are sure to affect some viewers. Almost banned from release in Australia. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: The Safety of objects
results.creator_credit: Rose Troche, Christine Vachon, Dorothy Berwin, Clear Blue Sky Productions and Renaissance Films
results.brief_description: Four suburban families and four seemingly separate stories about the struggles of daily life. Life that’s messy around the edges - how we deal with our problems and each other when living the suburban life are explored in this film. Consumer society, shopping and personal objects - how important are they when compared with love and family? Written and directed by Rose Troche, based on a book of stories by A.M.Homes. Cast includes Glenn Close, Dermot Mulroney, Jessica Campbell, Patricia Clarkson, Joshua Jackson, Moira Kelly.

results.title: Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind
results.creator_credit: Michel Gondry, Anthony Bregman, Steve Golin and Focus Features
results.brief_description: Joel (Jim Carrey) and Clementine’s (Kate Winslet) relationship isn’t going too well so she engages a psychiatrist to employ a process whereby Joel and the relationship is erased from her memory. On finding out about the procedure Joel thinks he’ll do the same but the couple actually re-discover more about the start of their relationship and what brought them together in the first place. In a quirky look at relationships, break-ups and a kind of love-conquers-all mystique this romantic/black comedy stems from the same key team that put together “Human Nature” - director Michel Gondry and writer Charlie Kaufman. Cast includes Kirsten Dunst, Mark Ruffalo, Elijah Wood, Tom Wilkinson.

results.title: Tape
results.creator_credit: Richard Linklater, Alexis Alexanian, Anne Walker-McBay, Gary Winick, Independent Film Channel and InDigEnt (US)
results.brief_description: Set in a dull Michigan motel room, based on a one-act play, comes Richard Linklater’s “Tape” shot digitally and edited using Final Cut software. Two high school friends Vince (Ethan Hawke) and John (Robert Sean-Leonard) re-unite as twenty-something adults to reminisce. Memory and real events are questioned with the arrival of Amy (Uma Thurman) who claims she was date-raped by both of them. Tense and gripping with wonderful performances from the three leads. Based on the stage play by Stephen Belber.

results.title: Far from Heaven
results.creator_credit: Todd Haynes, Christine Vachon, Jody Patton, Focus Features and Vulcan Productions
results.brief_description: Mrs Cathy Whitaker (Julianne Moore) is the equivalent of the 1950s super mom - running the household for her busy executive husband and two young children with the help of her African American maid Sybil. She has a busy social circle, doing good deeds for the community, all whilst being impeccably dressed and coiffured. But this nuclear family is not what it seems as the husband (Dennis Quaid) has a secret passion that cannot be quelled. A friendship with the gardener (Dennis Haysbert), an African American single father, develops into something deeper for Cathy but society deems their acquaintance as simply unacceptable. A film about relationships and society where people’s desires and needs are often at odds with a repressed moral code/sense of ethics, especially in 1950s America. Written and directed by Todd Haynes, with music by Elmer Bernstein. Highly stylised art direction and costume design appropriate to the period. Cast includes Viola Davis, Patricia Clarkson, Celia Weston.

results.title: Dirty pretty things
results.creator_credit: Stephen Frears, Robert Jones, Tracey Seaward, BBC Film Unit and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: An illegal immigrant in urban London, Okwe, is working as a cab driver and doing the nightshift as a hotel receptionist (Chiwetel Ejiofor). He is sharing a flat with one of the hotel’s maids, Senay, (Audrey Tautou’s first English speaking role) who is also an illegal but dreams of escaping to live in America. Initially the film is more a character study of the pair always living in fear of deportation and struggling with poverty but soon develops into a thriller as one night, a gruesome discovery in room 510’s blocked toilet, leads to blackmail and involvement with London’s sordid underworld. Cast includes Sergi Lopez, Benedict Wong and Sophie Okonedo.

results.title: Super size me
results.creator_credit: Morgan Spurlock, The Con, Roadside Attractions, Samuel Goldwyn Films and Showtime Independent
results.brief_description: Eating nothing but McDonald’s for one month, Morgan Spurlock discovers the effects of fast-food first-hand. Under medical supervision, he proves by his experiment that junk food does make you sick - and while it is a bit extreme to eat “Maccas” three meals a day, the film shows how American society is making itself unwell by eating fast food in great amounts and that obesity is one of the largest causes of illness and death in the country. The “Super Size” refers to the larger sizes on offer and Morgan makes the rule that when offered a Super Size he must eat it! Winner of Best Director 2004 Sundance Film Festival.

results.title: The film "Dogville" as told in nine chapters and a prologue
results.creator_credit: Lars Von Trier, Vibeke Windelov and Zentropa Entertainments8 APS
results.brief_description: Lars Von Trier’s films are distinctive and this film is no exception having been shot not unlike televised theatre of the 1970s with a stark stage-like set. Grace (Nicole Kidman) arrives in the township of Dogville as a fugitive running from a team of gangsters and seeking a safe haven. After some convincing from self-appointed town leader/philosopher Tom (Paul Bettany) the town agrees to hide her but at what price? Do they stay loyal to Grace or is the townsfolk’s reckoning worse for Grace than the band of gangsters? Official selection for Cannes 2003. Cast includes Jean-Marc Barr, Lauren Bacall, Harriet Andersson and James Caan.

Cast includes Jean-Marc Barr, Lauren Bacall, Harriet Andersson and James Caan.
description_for_label: Lars Von Trier’s films are distinctive and this film is no exception having been shot not unlike televised theatre of the 1970s with a stark stage-like set. Grace (Nicole Kidman) arrives in the township of Dogville as a fugitive running from a team of gangsters and seeking a safe haven. After some convincing from self-appointed town leader/philosopher Tom (Paul Bettany) the town agrees to hide her but at what price? Do they stay loyal to Grace or is the townsfolk’s reckoning worse for Grace than the band of gangsters? Official selection for Cannes 2003. Cast includes Jean-Marc Barr, Lauren Bacall, Harriet Andersson and James Caan.

results.title: The Hours
results.creator_credit: Stephen Daldry, Robert Fox, Scott Rudin, Miramax Films and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Faithful adaptation of Michael Cunningham’s acclaimed novel “The Hours”, garnered numerous Academy Award nominations including Best Actress prize for Nicole Kidman as Virginia Woolf. Using a three-episode structure the narrative shifts between the 1930s, 1950s and early 2000 with three women linked by the Woolf novel “Mrs Dalloway”. In the first part Woolf is depicted struggling with her novel and her waning mental health; next a suburban housewife and mother Laura Brown (Julianne Moore) is reading “Mrs Dalloway”, questioning her happiness and desire to live; lastly Clarissa Vaughn (Meryl Streep) is preparing a lavish dinner party for a dying friend who has won a celebrated literary prize. On this one day each woman experiences an array of emotions, including desire, despair and a yearning for something more; all are linked by motifs such as a kiss, interweaving their individual plights. As well the superb key performances, “The Hours” is bolstered by a strong supporting cast (Claire Danes, Ed Harris, Jeff Daniels, Allison Janney and Toni Collette), a lyrical Michael Nyman score and a pervasive air of melancholy and longing.
